revised_title: The Role of the False Tongue in Foals and Its Composition
tldr: The author, Professor Sewell, investigates the substance called the false tongue found in foals. He believes it is necessary for the foal's sucking action due to its unique respiratory system. Dr. Prout analyzes the substance, finding it to be composed mainly of slightly modified coagulated albumen. The author considers it a secretion from the foal's tongue.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Physiology
